hotspots.label: Compound Eyes
hotspots.fact: Mantises have large compound eyes that can see in almost all directions at once! This helps them spot prey and predators from far away.

hotspots.label: Front Legs
hotspots.fact: A mantis uses its powerful front legs to catch and hold insects. These legs fold up like a praying position, which is why it's called a 'praying' mantis!

hotspots.label: Spikes & Claws
hotspots.fact: The sharp spikes and claws on a mantis's front legs help it grip slippery insects. They work together like a deadly trap when the mantis strikes!

hotspots.label: Pink Flowers
hotspots.fact: Mantises often hide on flowers that match their green color to camouflage from prey. This makes them expert hunters that wait perfectly still for insects to visit!
